directions.step: Take the 10 sprigs of tarragon and lay them on a chopping board. Take a large knife and lay it flat on its side on top of your tarragon and hit the blade gently with your fist several times to bruise the tarragon underneath.

You'll know you are doing it right if you can smell the tarragon strongly after hitting it - bruising breaks some of the cell fibres in the tarragon allowing it to release its oils better into your sugar syrup.

Make the tarragon syrup by placing the water, sugar and tarragon in a pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, whisking occasionally to dissolve the sugar. Reduce to a simmer and cook for about 25 minutes until the mixture is reduced and slightly thickened. Set aside and allow to cool, then strain into a jug and set aside.
Place the lemon juice and water in a large pitcher with and stir in the tarragon syrup to taste. Add lots of ice and a few sprigs of tarragon to garnish.
